title: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 20th century
inscribed: Imprinted in black ink, center right: SX
description:
Large calligraphic mark with 5 tiny red silhouettes arranged overall. Imprinted in red, upper left corner: Tai Chi Ch’uan / Cloud Hands is a center for Tai Chi, Meditation, / and the Healing Arts. Beginning Tai Chi students / should enroll in Part I which they should take at / least  twice a week—with the option of taking all / three classes, at no additional cost. / Cloud Hands / is open every day for intermediate and advanced / students from 5 to 8 p.m.
Instructors: /Tem Horwitz and Susan Kimmelman are / co-directors of Cloud Hands, founders of / MoMing, and co-authored Tai Chi Ch’uan: / The Technique of Power. / Term: May 9 to August 5 (13 weeks) / Schedule of Tai Chi: / Part I (Beginning) / M 6-7:30 W 6-7:30 F 6-7:30 / Part II / Tu 6-7:30 Th 6-7:30 / Part III / Sat 10-12 / Review / Tu 6-7:30 / Fees: Part I $110 / Part II $100 / Part III & Review $100 / Review $50 / Trial Classes $3 / Enroll at First Class Session / Acupressure & Shiatsu / Beginning: Thursdays, 8-9:30 p.m. / Intermediate: Tuesdays, 8-9:30 p.m. / May 9 to June 15 Six Weeks, Tuition: $40. / Payable at first session. / Instructor: Raymond Himel (B.Ac., C.A.); lower right: Cloud Hands / Center For Tai Chi, Dance, Meditation / 9 W. Hubbard, Chicago, Illinois 60610 / 312.644.8087 & 348.0010

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Cloud Hands, Center for T", 20th century. Offset lithograph on paper. 1991-69-16.
